FRANCHISE AGREEMENT ‚Äì Simplified Summary

1. Parties involved:
o Chai Junction Pvt. Ltd.
o AND
Mumbai Food Ventures LLP, a Limited Liability Partnership registered under the LLP
o Franchise Development
FOR MUMBAI FOOD VENTURES LLP
o hereinafter referred to as the ‚ÄúFranchisor‚Äù)
2. Purpose: The Franchisee shall pay the Franchisor a one-time, non-refundable Initial Franchise Fee of 10,00,000/- (Rupees Ten Lakh only) The Franchisor may terminate this Agreement with immediate effect upon written notice to the Franchisee.
3. Obligations of the Receiving Party:
o Keep the information in strict confidence and protect it like its own confidential data.
o Not share it with any third party without the written consent of the Disclosing Party.
o Use it only for the Purpose and nothing else.
o Share it only with employees, directors, advisors, or consultants who need to know, provided they also follow confidentiality obligations.
4. Term: This Agreement is effective for 5 years from the Effective Date.
5. , a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, having its corporate office at #500, 100 Feet Road, Indiranagar, Bangalore, Karnataka - 560038, India, represented by its authorized signatory (herein).

info.title: FRANCHISE AGREEMENT
parties:
AND
Mumbai Food Ventures LLP, a Limited Liability Partnership registered under the LLP

Franchise Development
FOR MUMBAI FOOD VENTURES LLP

hereinafter referred to as the ‚ÄúFranchisee‚Äù).
RECITALS:
A. The Franchisor owns and operates a chain of cafes under the trade name and trademark ‚ÄúChai Junction‚Äù (the ‚ÄúBrand‚Äù)
legal_concepts: The Franchisee shall promptly return the Operations Manual and de-identify the Premises to remove all association with the Brand
Royalty Fee: The Franchisee shall pay the Franchisor an ongoing monthly Royalty Fee equal to 6% (six percent) of the Gross Sales of the Franchised Unit

Any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Agreement shall be referred to and finally resolved by arbitration conducted by a sole arbitrator appointed in accordance with the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996
The Franchisee may have the option to renew the franchise for an additional term of 5 years, subject to the terms and conditions of the then-current franchise agreement

FRANCHISE AGREEMENT
This Franchise Agreement (the ‚ÄúAgreement‚Äù) is made and entered into at Mumbai on this 22nd day of August, 2025

TERM AND RENEWAL
The term of this Agreement shall be for a period of 5 (five) years commencing from the date the Franchised Unit opens for business
Purchase all proprietary products and ingredients (such as special tea blends) exclusively from the Franchisor or its designated suppliers

POST-TERMINATION OBLIGATIONS
Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Franchisee shall immediately cease to operate the Franchised Unit and shall stop using all of the Franchisor's intellectual property
The Franchisee acknowledges that it has no ownership rights in the Brand or the System, and all goodwill associated with the Brand belongs exclusively to the Franchisor

TERMINATION
The Franchisor may terminate this Agreement with immediate effect upon written notice to the Franchisee if the Franchisee defaults in the performance of any of its material obligations, including failure to pay fees, failure to adhere to brand standards, or insolvency

Initial Franchise Fee: The Franchisee shall pay the Franchisor a one-time, non-refundable Initial Franchise Fee of ‚Çπ10,00,000/- (Rupees Ten Lakh only) plus applicable GST upon signing this Agreement

Marketing Fee: The Franchisee shall pay the Franchisor an ongoing monthly Marketing Fee equal to 2% (two percent) of the Gross Sales of the Franchised Unit, to be contributed to a national marketing fund
3, Ground Floor, Phoenix Marketcity Mall, LBS Marg, Kurla (West), Mumbai - 400070 (the ‚ÄúPremises‚Äù)
The Franchisor has developed a unique and proprietary system for operating these cafes, including recipes, operational methods, marketing techniques, and store designs (the ‚ÄúSystem‚Äù)
